quote: I have long been interested in   the notion of time travel. In   fact, I wrote a book about it...   It chronicled the tale of a man   from our era who fouled the sixth   century by introducing newfangled   gadgets and weapons... all in the   name of Progress.       The idea of time travelers isn't   so far fetched as it seems...   in fact, I have learned that, even   now, people from the future are   right here in San Francisco...   and I have no doubt that they are   intent on fouling our world...   just like my Yankee did in King   Arthur's time.       Well. Let me serve notice: as   soon as I get the necessary   evidence, I intend to expose   them... and make it absolutely   clear that they are not welcome   here.
Yes, sir. And will this be a   sequel to "Connecticut Yankee,"   Mister Twain?
The name's Clemens, son. Sam   Clemens, with an "e."
With an "e"... got it.
'Scuse me.
The coroner said this room   contained all the cholera   victims...
It doesn't make sense that so many   people are dying of cholera --   it just isn't that virulent.
Wil... this is strange...
What is it?
The cerebral cortex... the   cerebellum... the brain stem...   the entire nervous system -- has   been drained of electrochemical   energy.       Here's another one... same neural   depletion...
These people didn't die of cholera   -- they died because their neural   energy was drained somehow.
Drained... and taken to Devidia   Two... for those aliens to   ingest.
If you were a time-traveller with   a taste for human neural energy...   how would you get your supply?
I'd travel back to times when   there were plagues and   epidemics... when I could murder   -- and use disease as a cover.
Over half the victims who'd been   drained of neural energy came from   a place called Sisters of Hope   Infirmary.
It's a charity hospital near the   waterfront.
If the aliens have been killing   people there, someone might have   noticed something unusual...
If they're moving among humans,   they must have taken human form.   The question is, how do we know   who we're looking for... ?
The tricorder picked up evidence   of triolic activity in most of   the bodies we looked at. If the   aliens are leaving that signature   behind, they'll be detectable.
We might even be able to set   up some kind of alien alarm   system.
Any luck contacting Data?
None. The tricorder is   broadcasting random emissions...   but the range is pretty limited.   Almost anything could interfere...
She's back.
Mister Picard!
Coming, Mrs. Carmichael...
Mister Picard... I'd be remindin'   you that it's one o'clock.
Yes... ?
One o'clock of a Thursday.
I'm sure I made it clear to you   that the rent is always due,   payable in full, by one o'clock   on Wednesdays.
Ah. The... rent.
Mrs. Carmichael, my troupe is even   now in rehearsals for a new   production.
Oh? I haven't heard of any new   production. What play is it?
It's -- "A Midsummer Night's   Dream."
We've performed in London...   Paris... Milan... all to sold   out houses. I assure you, we'll   be able to pay the rent... with   a bonus.
No, no, no... I've heard you   silver-tongued devils before...
I'll have the rent in full...   tomorrow... by one o'clock -- or   you'll be performing on the   street.
I wouldn't do this for just   anybody, Mister Clemens. And I   hope you won't spread it around   that I let you in...
Of course not, Jack. And I assure   you -- Mister Data would be most   upset if you didn't.
If I don't find that Letter of   Intent he left for me... our major   investor is going to pull out and   take his business elsewhere.
It has to do with Mister Data's   engine, doesn't it?
Engine...
Yes... yes... this is exactly what   it's all about...
Mister Clemens... I'm gonna do   you another favor today...
(still looking at     device)   Mmmmmm...
You're always looking for good   stories, right?       Well, I've got a humdinger.
Uh-huh...

The story of -- my life. Now,   I know you might think I'm   young... but I've covered a lot   of ground, and if I do say so,   it'd make for some pretty   fascinating reading.       So. What do you think?
About what?
About writing my life story. You   and me -- literary partners.
You know, son, there's a maxim   I've always lived by: no one's   more qualified to write your story   than you are.
Me? Be a writer? You think I   could?
Long as you write what you know...   you got any passions, son? Any   dreams?
I'd like to do some travelling...   maybe go to sea... and Alaska.   I've always had a notion to see   Alaska.
That's a great idea. If I were   your age, that's exactly what I'd   do... Alaska -- the Klondike...   the Aurora Borealis... that's it,   follow your dreams. And write   about them.
Thank you! Thank you, Mister   Clemens. That's just what I'm   going to do!
You do that, son --
You'll be seeing my name in print.       London... the name's London.
I'm sure I will. Good-bye now.
... so when I finally got to the   Head Surveyor... I found the   location of your cavern. But   you won't be able to get to it.
Why is that?
The only entrance is a mine   shaft... right in the middle of   the Presidio... the Army Fort.
Perhaps you could arrange for us   to get in.
What?
With permission to dig for the   mine shaft.
Data... so far I've been able to   do everything you asked me to.   But do you really expect me to   get you into a high-security   military installation?
I have full confidence in your   persuasive abilities.
Well... this is more interesting   than giving tea dances.
That is strange...
What?
I left this device activated...   but the transceiver assembly has   been removed... without it I will   be unable to track the time   shifts.
Clemens.
Samuel Clemens?
He's been driving me crazy. He   watches the house, follows me down   the street asking questions --   I'd bet you anything he got in   here and took your -- whatever   you said.
If you are correct, he must be   told that the device has been   modified in such a way that   prolonged contact with human   tissue would be highly toxic.
Madame Guinan... Mister Data...   good day.
Mister Clemens... shame on you.
Shame, madame? I think not. I   find no shame in my efforts to   uncover your plot.
I keep telling you, there is no   plot --

Yes... you do keep telling me   that.    (a beat, as he regards     her)   Mister Data, did you know that   Madame Guinan here is from a   renowned Boston family... a close   relative of Judge Truman Williams?       I believe that's what you said...
Yes.
Then... I wonder... why the Judge   says he's never heard of you?   That's what his telegram to me   indicated...
There's been a blood feud between   two branches of the family. He   doesn't acknowledge me.
Ah. That must wound you deeply.
What an interesting pair you   are... an Ashanti princess...   and a Swiss. Where in Switzerland   are you from, Mister Data?
I am French, not Swiss.

Of course, that's right... now   I remember. A Frenchman with   a talent for poker, from what I   hear.       You know, I was talking with a   friend of mine, Ches Whitley...   he said to say hello... wonders   when you're coming back.
I do not believe I know Mister   Whitley.

No? He works at the County   Assayer's Office... said you've   been in there several times...   claiming to be a geological   engineer. Wanting information   about mining operations during   the 1850's...       Remember him now?
I do not know the gentleman by   name. I have spoken to several   people in that office.
Yes... I know. And in the Hall   of Records... and the Geological   Society... and a little-known   mineral shop in Chinatown. You   do get around, don't you?
As apparently you do, Mister   Clemens.
I must admit -- you've got me   mystified.
This contraption, for instance.   Very unusual. It looks quite --   futuristic. Tell me -- might   it have something to do with   "time shifts"?
In a sense. The time shift is   a new gearing system that I have   invented... for a horseless   carriage.

Do not insult me.       You've come to this century and   brought your infernal technology   with you... for God only knows   what purpose... but I have no   doubt that it will be the people   of this century who will suffer   for it.
Mister Clemens, I think we've had   quite enough of this. Mister   Data's business is his own, and   I'd thank you to leave.
Pardon me, Madame, but it is   my business... it is the business   of all humanity, I believe, to   stop both of you from whatever   it is you are doing here. And   that is what I intend to do.
He won't last the day.
Aren't we going to treat him?
I wish we could. But at this   point there's nothing to be done.   Unless you know of some miracle   treatment.
Why don't we try an alkaline   saline solution... to counteract   dehydration?
Nurse, if that were helpful,   don't you think I would have   ordered it?
Now, you finish the charts and   leave the practice of medicine   to me.
Yes, Doctor.
... did your friend have any   visitors before he died?
No... had no family... only people   to come were doctor and nurse.
Very bad doctor.
Only spent time with one man.   I ask for water... he ignore me.   Others cry in pain... doctor does   not care.       Very bad.
Hello, Officer. This the   Infirmary?
Yes. The entrance is right there.
Just what is it you're doing with   those lamps?
Replacing the wick screws. City   ordinance... makes it safer in   case of an earthquake.
There hasn't been an earthquake   here in thirty years.
That's it for this ward. Have   to be moving on.
Earthquakes...       Nurse, if you can handle things   here, I have a meeting with the   Board of Patrons.
I'm sure I'll manage.
There... by that bed. I can see   an afterimage of triolic waves.   They were here recently... within   the last twenty-four hours.
That's the bed where someone died   last night...
(pointing to the male     patient)   This man was complaining about   a strange doctor and nurse who   visited that patient.       They might still be in the   hospital.
This will make you more   comfortable...
Do you need any help, Doctor?
Doctor Apollinaire felt he had   entered the algid stage... he was   cyanotic, pulse unobservable...
That's an interesting cane...
Hold it!
What's all this? What's going   on here?
Apparently a distraught   relative... she became quite   upset... we tried to calm her but   she ran out.
I heard an explosion...
(as if he's just     arrived)   How about it? You people see any   explosion?
There was nothing like that,   Officer...
Okay, folks, I suggest you all   clear out and let the patients   have a little peace... sorry,   Doctor.
People said there was gunfire in   here... What's going on?
Just a misunderstanding... I'm   clearing these people out of here.
I've never seen you before...
Just got assigned this morning.   Usually work downtown.
I worked downtown for three   years... I don't remember you.
Hold it!
I'm going to ask all of you to   come down to the station for   questioning.       Including you. Let's go...
Where'd you get that? That's a   gentleman's cane.
Never saw a cane like this before.       I'll have to confiscate it.   Evidence.
I want you to know... I have only   the greatest respect for the law.
Data!
Boy, am I glad to see you!
I would suggest we postpone our   greetings for another occasion.
Agreed. Let's get out of here.
If we tune a phaser to the   approximate frequency of triolic   waves, and lay down a field   burst... it might respond.
The ophidian the aliens were   carrying...
What the...
Minute space-time distortions...   like the one we saw on Devidia   Two...
But they were so small... and   they only lasted a second...
The aliens seem to have the   ability to concentrate the   distortion -- and direct it toward   a specific time and destination.
Maybe they have something... a   -- mechanism, that focuses it.
Any device like that would produce   significant levels of triolic   waves...       ... like the ones in the cavern   where Data's head was found.
I have located that cavern --
Mister Picard!
I know you're in there! Open the   door!
Mrs. Carmichael... thank goodness   you're here.
How now, spirit! whither wander   you?
Over hill, over dale, Through   bush, through brier, Over park,   over pale...
Ah -- just in time! We need   someone to read a part...
Mister Picard, I need to be   talkin' to you...
Ill met by moonlight, proud   Titania.
Now, Mrs. Carmichael...       Right there...
Ill met by moonlight, proud   Titania.
What, jealous Oberon. Fairies   skip hence. I have foresworn his   bed and company.
Well, I don't need to hear any   more. That was -- truly unique.
Really?
I think we've found our Titania...       ... don't you agree?
Well... I did do a church play   when I was a lass...
You see? We'll begin rehearsals   tomorrow.
What theatre did you say?
There you are! I have good news   -- we can get into the Presidio   --
It is all right.

General Mallory is usually a   stickler for the rules... but I   happen to know that his wife   thinks she's a singer. So I told   him she simply must perform at   my next gathering... and the rules   just... disappeared.
You know me...
Very well.
Do I know you?
Not yet. But you will.
Thanks for your help, Officer.
Make sure you put in the part   about me spotting that phony   policeman.
Yessir, I will.
H'lo, son...
Mister Clemens... what brings you   here?
A writer's curiosity...
I heard two people vanished into   thin air in this Infirmary.
One of the patients said that,   yessir. But the police deny it.
I'll bet they do...
They say a band of outlaws set   off an explosion in the   hospital... then escaped.
What did these outlaws look like?
The carriage they escaped in was   driven by an albino...
Ah. Mister Data.
You know him?
You bet I do. You say there   were others with him?
Yes -- at least a dozen.
His accomplices... they've come   from the future -- my God, it's   an invasion.
An invasion... from the future?   Mister Clemens... what can you   tell me about this? Do you have   any proof?
Young man... when's your deadline?
Five o'clock, sir.
I'll meet you at your paper at   four-thirty... with a story that   will make your career.
Thanks, Mister Clemens...
Take me to the Presidio, driver.   And don't spare the whip.
The triolic levels are as high   as they were on Devidia Two...       ... but no indication of any   control mechanism.
I'm not so sure.
My VISOR is picking up crystalline   fractures. These cavern walls   have undergone some kind of   selective molecular polarization.
In fact, if I'm right... this   whole cavern has been configured   to focus the space-time   distortion... just like a lens.
Captain, we think we're on to   something. The cavern itself   seems to be acting as a focusing   mechanism... and I'm betting the   same is true of their habitat   back on Devidia Two.
If we can get back there... and   destroy that site... can we put   an end to their time   traveling... ?
We have the ophidian...
But I don't know if it will work.   The energy our phasers generate   may not be entirely compatible   with the ophidian.
We have no choice but to try.
An event I would most certainly   enjoy witnessing...

Move along... I suspect even   time travellers are vulnerable   to a Colt Forty-Five.    (removes watch, glances     at it)   Let's go -- I've made a young   fellow a promise and I don't want   to be late.
Follow him!
Is everybody all right?
I think so...
You--!
(rising to his feet,     brushing himself off)   Where are we -- and when is this?
It's the twenty-fourth century...   this is Devidia Two -- and you   shouldn't be here.
Seems to me I have as much right   to be in your time as you had to   be in mine. You see, sir, I   wanted to see how you've conducted   my future affairs.
Your future affairs?
The affairs of mankind.
Don't you see -- the disappearance   of Mark Twain... one of the most   noted literary figures of the   nineteenth century...
Thank you...
... that's not supposed to happen.
I have only taken advantage of   an irresistible occasion... as   any good writer would.
Bridge to Away Team...   acknowledge.
We're here, Mister Worf. How long   have we been gone?
You have been off sensor displays   for almost nine days, sir.
Stand by to transport five...
Commander...
Mister Worf... six to transport.
Where are we... ?
The Federation Starship   Enterprise.       Chief, call security. We need   an escort for this man.
Security? What for?
A werewolf...
It's a long story, Mister Worf...   I'll brief you later.
Have Data's body brought to the   Medical Lab. I'm going to try   to re-attach the head we have.
That head is almost five hundred   years old...
It's the best chance we've got.
I want Mister Clemens here under   escort at all times.
Commander... perhaps I could   handle that. I'd be happy to take   Mister Clemens to quarters.
Good idea.       If you would accompany the   Counselor...
Madame... I'd be delighted.
So this is a space ship, eh? Did   you ever run into Halley's comet?
Whoa... everything's spinning...
Don't try to sit up too quickly...   you've lost a lot of blood.
Where'd... everybody go... ?
I hope they're safely back on the   Enterprise by now.
You're still here...
You were hurt. I had to make sure   you were all right.
You stayed here... for that... ?
I can't very well let anything   happen to you... you're far too   important to me.
You know... so much about me...
Believe me, in the future the   tables will be turned.
We... become friends...
It goes beyond friendship.
But... I have to wait... almost   five hundred years...       And when we meet... I won't be   able to tell you about this, will   I?
No. Because for me, it won't have   happened yet.
What happened... ?
History fulfilling itself...
History has to fulfill itself.   Even Picard knew that.
You were there, in the cavern.   You know what happened. What   am I supposed to do?
Damn it, Guinan, don't play games   with me... I need answers.
If I tell you what happened in   that cavern, it would affect any   decision you're about to make.   I can't do that. I won't do that.
Not telling me might affect my   decision, too... did you think   of that?
We're talking about Jean-Luc   Picard. I'm not going to sit   around and hope it all works   out... I've got to do something...
Any place that doesn't stock a   good cigar doesn't rank high in   my book.
If you must have one, I'm sure   we could replicate it for you.
You think one of those --   imitations -- could take the place   of a hand-wrapped Havana?
I wouldn't know...
That's the problem I see here...   all this technology... it only   serves to take away life's simple   pleasures. You don't even let   a man open a door for a lady.
I think what we've gained   outweighs anything that might have   been lost...
Oh? I'm not so impressed with   this future... huge starships...   weapons that can no doubt destroy   entire cities... military conquest   as a way of life.
Is that what you see here?
Oh, I know what you say... this   is a vessel of exploration... your   mission is to, discover new   worlds...
Deck thirty-six.

That's what the Spanish said...   and the Dutch, and the Portuguese.   It's what all conquerors say...       I'm sure it's what you told that   blue skinned fellow I just   saw... before you brought him   here to serve you.
He's one of thousands of species   we've encountered. We live in   a peaceful Federation with many   of them... the people you see are   here by choice.
So there are a privileged few...   who serve on these ships, living   in luxury, wanting for nothing.   But what about everyone else?   What about the poor? You ignore   them...
Poverty was eliminated a long time   ago. And a lot of things   disappeared with it:   hopelessness... despair...   cruelty... war...

I come from a time when men   achieve wealth and power by   standing on the backs of the   poor... when prejudice and   intolerance are commonplace...   when power is an end unto   itself...       And you're telling me... that   isn't how it is anymore?
That's right.
Maybe it is worth giving up cigars   for, after all...
Tell me.... how long was it...   before things began to change?
A long time. The people of your   lifetime won't see it.
Is it working?
Not so far. His restart units   won't initialize.
I thought his buffering program   would have protected them... but   I guess five hundred years was   just too long a wait.
My watch...
It was found in the cavern... near   Data's head.       After five hundred years, I   doubt that it'll work either.
Mister Data... I fear I sadly   misjudged you.       As I have misjudged many things.
Can you communicate?
Yes...
Are you injured?
Why have you interfered?
You hunt us... you kill us. We   cannot allow that.
We need your energy...
Perhaps we could find a   substitute...
No... there is none... we must   continue.
We cannot allow that.       We know how you move back and   forth through time... my crew   has returned to the twenty-fourth   century to destroy your transport   site on Devidia Two --
Destroy it?
Your weapons will only amplify   the time distortion... you will   annihilate your own world...
I'm going back for the Captain...   Mister Worf, prepare an Away Team   to accompany me to the surface.       Doctor, I need to know anything   you can tell me about that   ophidian.
I've just started running some   tests. If I could have a few   hours...
We can't give the aliens any   more time...
Wil, I haven't been able to   determine if our phaser energy   can generate a stable field.   The risk would be --
I accept the risk.
Sir... permission to speak   frankly?
Go ahead.
Our priority is to stop the aliens   from making any more incursions   to Earth. Any delay is   unacceptable.
If I can save Captain Picard, I   consider it very acceptable.
The Captain would not.       I recommend we target photon   torpedoes on the alien habitat   and destroy it immediately.
He's right, Wil.
Mister Worf, power up the   photons. Inform me when you're   ready.
Computer... calibrate the power   flow polarity selector...
Polarity selector is calibrated.
Computer... initialize the   re-load circuits.
Re-load circuits are initializing.
C'mon, Data... this ought to do   it...
Okay, Computer... deactivate the   polarity selector.       I don't get it... why isn't this   working?
Computer, run a diagnostic on the   input polarizers.
There is intermittent contact   in the input polarizers.
Intermittent?
An iron filing... how did that   get in there?
Commander, I have set the photons   to fire in staggered rounds,   detonating in ten-second   intervals.
Very well. Fire when ready.
The sequence will be ready to   initiate in one minute.
Computer, try another diagnostic   on the input polarizers.
Polarizer circuits are   functioning.
Then that should do it...
Okay, Data... come on, now...
...torpedoes... don't phasing...   aliens...
I am processing a binary message   that was entered into my static   memory by Captain Picard.       Geordi, are we planning to fire   on the alien habitat?
Yeah, but --
It is imperative that we do not.   I will explain later.
La Forge to Riker -- hold your   fire!

The binary message left by the   Captain is not entirely clear.       He seemed to be concerned about   the phase differential of our   photon torpedoes... that firing   them might produce a catastrophic   effect.
Then how do we destroy their   habitat?
If I am correct... we must modify   our weapons so that the force of   the explosion is re-phased into   the aliens' time continuum.
If we outfit the photons with   phase discriminators... we could   get the necessary variance.
How long will it take you?
At least a couple of hours.
Fine. That'll give me time to   go get him.
Sir?
There's time now... I'm going   back to the nineteenth century   for the Captain.       Doctor... ?
My analysis of the phasers   suggests you'd be able to open   a rift... but it won't be stable   enough to transport more than one   person.
You mean... if I go back... only   one of us could return.
That's right.
Then I have the perfect solution   for you.
I'm the one who should return to   the nineteenth century,   Commander... and remain there   so your Captain can return.
There's a risk... we're not   certain how stable the rift will   be...
There's risk in everything. The   point is -- it's the right choice.   I have more books to write... your   Captain has a job to do here...
Mister La Forge... brief him on   what he'll need to do.
I'm glad I have the chance to   thank you.
For what?
For starting me on the greatest   adventure a man's ever had. For   helping a bitter old man open his   eyes... so he can see that the   future turns out pretty well,   after all.
Guinan...
...thirsty...
I'm going to get help. We have   to get you out of here...
...wait... stay a while... maybe   they'll come for you...
No. You need help.
This thing put me down in the   middle of Market Street. It took   forever to get here...
Sir, Commander La Forge has   completed the re-configuration   of the photon torpedoes.
If Clemens got back, the Captain   should have been here by now.
We have no way of knowing if   Mister Clemens was successful.
Re-establish your firing pattern,   Mister Worf. We'll wait five more   minutes.
Yes, Commander.

No time for chit-chat, sir...       According to Mister La Forge --   who did get your message by the   way -- a frequency setting of   point-oh-four-seven on your phaser   will correctly activate this   creature.
You'll have to get help. Guinan   needs medical attention...
I promise you she will be attended   to.
We have a bill at Mrs.   Carmichael's boarding house --
It will be settled.
Thank you.       I wish time had allowed me to know   you better...
You'll just have to read my books.   What I am is pretty much there.
I'll see you in five hundred   years, Picard.
I'll see you... in a few minutes.
Commander... I am picking up   massive triolic wave activity on   the surface.
Is it the Captain?
There are no human life signs.
No sign of a temporal distortion?
No, sir. But triolic activity   is increasing.
The aliens...
Mister Worf, are the photons   ready?
Yes, sir.
Fire.
Torpedoes away, sir.
Commander -- I am detecting a   temporal distortion on the   surface... and human life signs.
O'Brien -- get him out of there!
Transporter Room -- do you have   him?
He does indeed, Commander. And   believe me... it's good to be   back.
We have destroyed the target, sir.   There is no further indication   of triolic activity.
Ensign, lay in a course to the   nearest Starbase. Warp six.
Captain's Log, Stardate 46001.3.

Everyone who should be in the   nineteenth century is safely   there, and those who should be   in the twenty-fourth are here.   Mister Data has been restored to   us, head and all... and Samuel   Clemens will write the books he   was to have written after our   encounter.
Be careful not to jostle her too   much, boys...       Don't worry... you're going to   be fine...
